verses.text: On the eighth day, he is to take for himself two turtledoves or two young doves, bring them to the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to offer them—one for a sin offering and the other for a whole burnt offering. That’s how the priest will make atonement for him in the Lord’s presence regarding his discharge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has a seminal emission, he is to bathe his entire body with water and remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every garment (including leather) on which the semen is found is to be washed with water, and it will remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man has sexual relations with a woman and the man releases semen, both are to bathe with water, and they will remain unclean until evening.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a woman has a discharge, and the blood is her monthly menstrual discharge from her body, then for seven days she is to remain in her menstrual uncleanness. Whoever touches her will remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that she sleeps on during her uncleanness will be unclean. Moreover, everything that she sits on will become unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches her bed is to wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches any of the objects on which she has sat is to wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any bed or other object on which she sat that he touches will make him unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man has sexual relations with her and her menstrual uncleanness touches him, he will be unclean for seven days. Every bed where he sleeps will remain unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a woman has a continuous discharge of blood many days beyond the time of her menstrual uncleanness, or if she has a discharge that lasts beyond the days of her menstrual uncleanness, her uncleanness is to be treated like the days of her menstruation—she’s unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every bed on which she sleeps the whole time she has the discharge will be her own unclean bed, so that every object on which she sits becomes unclean like her menstrual uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches them will become unclean. He is to wash his clothes and bathe with water and he will remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If she becomes clean with her discharge, then she is to count for herself seven days, after which she becomes clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day, she is to take for herself two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to offer one for a sin offering and the other for a whole burnt offering. This is how the priest will make atonement in the Lord’s presence for her regarding her unclean discharge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So separate the Israelis from their uncleanness so that they won’t die in their uncleanness if they defile my tent that is in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the regulations for one whose discharge of semen causes him to become unclean because of it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for her whose menstruation causes her to become ill, for anyone who has a discharge (whether male or female), and for the man who has sexual relations with one who is unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron’s two sons when they had approached the Lord and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Remind your brother Aaron that at no time is he to enter the sacred place from the room that contains the curtain into the presence of the Mercy Seat on top of the ark. Otherwise, he’ll die, because I will appear in a cloud at the Mercy Seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is to enter the sacred place with a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a whole burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to wear a sacred linen tunic and linen undergarments that will cover his genitals. He is to clothe himself with a sash and wrap his head with a linen turban. Because they are sacred garments, he is to wash himself with water before putting them on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is to take two male goats for a sin offering and one ram for a whole burnt offering from the assembly of the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron is to bring the bull as a sin offering for himself and make atonement for himself and his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he is to take the two male goats and present them in the Lord’s presence at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is to cast lots over the two male goats—one lot for the Lord and the other one for the scapegoat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is then to bring the male goat on which the lot fell for the Lord and offer it as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The male goat on which the lot fell for the scapegoat is to be brought alive into the Lord’s presence to make atonement for himself. Then he is to send it into the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron is then to bring the bull for a sin offering for himself, thus making atonement for himself and his household. He is to slaughter the ox for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he is to take a censer and fill it with coals from the fire on the altar in the Lord’s presence. With his hands full of spiced and refined incense, he is to bring it beyond the curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he is to place the incense over the fire in the Lord’s presence, ensuring that the smoke from the incense covers the Mercy Seat, according to regulation, so he won’t die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to take blood from the ox and sprinkle it with his forefinger toward the surface of the Mercy Seat. Then he is to sprinkle the blood on the surface of the Mercy Seat with his forefinger seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is to slaughter the male goat as a sin offering for the people and bring its blood beyond the curtain and do with its blood as he did with the blood of the bull: He is to sprinkle it on the Mercy Seat—that is, over the surface of the Mercy Seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he is to make atonement on the sacred place on account of the uncleanness of the Israelis, their transgressions, and all their sins. This is how he is to act in the Tent of Meeting, which will remain with them in the middle of their uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No person is to be there when he enters the Tent of Meeting to make atonement in the sacred place, until he comes out and has made atonement on account of himself, his household, and the entire assembly of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he goes to the altar in the Lord’s presence to make atonement for himself, he is to take some of the blood from the bull and the male goat, place it around the horns of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sprinkle it with the blood on his forefinger seven times, cleansing and sanctifying it from Israel’s sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he has completed making atonement at the sacred place, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, then he is to present the live male goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is to lay his two hands upon the head of the male goat and confess over it the sins of Israel, all their transgressions, and all their sins, thus placing them on the head of the male goat that he’ll then send out to the wilderness by the hand of a man capable of carrying out this task.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The male goat will bear on itself all their sins to a solitary land as Aaron sends the goat out to the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then Aaron is to enter the Tent of Meeting, take off his white linen clothes that he had put on when he entered the sacred place, and leave them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to wash his body with water at the sacred place and put on his clothes. Then he is to go out and offer a whole burnt offering for himself and a whole burnt offering for the people, thereby making atonement on account of himself and on account of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As to the fat from the burnt offering, he is to incinerate it on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who sent away the male goat as a scapegoat is to wash his clothes and bathe his body with water. After doing so, he may enter the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The bull for the sin offering and the male goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought into the sacred place, are to be taken outside the camp. Their skin, meat, and offal are to be incinerated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who burns them is to wash his clothes and bathe his body with water. After doing so, he may enter the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is to be a perpetual statute for you: On the tenth day of the seventh month, you (including both the native born and the resident alien) are to humble yourselves by not doing any work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because on that day, atonement will be made for you to cleanse you from all your sins. You are to be clean in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s the Sabbath of all Sabbaths for you, so humble yourselves. This is to be a perpetual statute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest who has been anointed and consecrated to be priest after his father is to make the atonement. He is to put on the sacred linen clothing
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make atonement for the sacred sanctuary, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar where atonement is carried out. He is also to make atonement for the priests and the people of the entire assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This will be a perpetual statute for you as you make atonement once a year for the Israelis on account of all their sins.”
So Moses did just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelis and tell them that this is what the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a person from the house of Israel slaughters an ox, a lamb, or a goat (whether in the camp or outside the camp),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but fails to bring it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting as an offering in the presence of the tent of the Lord, that person will incur bloodguilt. Because he has shed blood, that person is to be eliminated from contact with his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This statute is required so that the Israelis may bring their sacrifices that they have been sacrificing to the Lord in the open field to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, where they are to slaughter their peace offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to sprinkle the blood on the Lord’s altar at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and incinerate the fat, making a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are no longer to slaughter their sacrifices to the goat demons, with whom they have been committing prostitution. This will be a perpetual statute for you throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them that if a person from the house of Israel or a resident alien who lives among you brings a whole burnt offering or a sacrifice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, but fails to bring it to offer it to the Lord, that person is to be eliminated from contact with his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone from the house of Israel or a resident alien who lives among you eats any form of blood, I’ll oppose that person who ate the blood and eliminate him from his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the life of the flesh is in the blood itself, and I myself have given it to you all so that atonement may be made for your souls on the altar, since the blood itself makes atonement through the life that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why I’ve told the Israelis that no person among you is to eat blood. Even the resident alien who lives among you is not to eat blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a person from the house of Israel or a resident alien who lives among you has hunted live game or a bird that may be eaten, he is to extract its blood and cover it with soil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the life of any flesh is the blood itself. Therefore, I’m saying to the Israelis that the blood of any flesh is not to be eaten, because the life of any flesh is in its blood. Anyone who eats of it is to be eliminated from contact with his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Any person who eats a carcass or an animal that was torn by beasts (whether that person is native born or is a resident alien), is to wash his clothes and bathe himself with water, and he will remain unclean until evening, and then he’ll become clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he doesn’t wash or bathe his body, then he is to bear the punishment of his iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to do what you used to do in the land of Egypt where you lived. You are not to do what Canaan does, where I’m about to bring you, so that you live according to their statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey my ordinances and keep my statutes by living by them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep my statutes and my ordinances, which a person is to obey in order to live in them. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A person is not to approach a near blood relative for sexual relations. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Neither your father’s nakedness nor your mother’s nakedness is to be exposed. She’s your mother, so you are not to have sexual relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your father’s wife. It’s your own father’s nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your sister, whether she’s your father’s daughter or your mother’s daughter, whether she’s born in your home or outside your home. You are not to have sexual relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter. You are not to have sexual relations with them, because their nakedness is your own nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with the daughter of your father’s wife. Born of your father, she’s your sister, so you are not to have sexual relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your father’s sister. She’s your father’s near blood relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your mother’s sister. She’s your mother’s near blood relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to expose the nakedness of your father’s brother by having sexual relations with his wife. She’s your aunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to expose the nakedness of your daughter-in-law. She’s the wife of your son. You are not to have sexual relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your brother’s wife. She’s the nakedness of your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are not to have sexual relations with a woman and her daughter.
“You are not to have sexual relations with her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter. They’re near blood relatives. It’s wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to marry a woman and then have sexual relations with her sister as a rival when your wife is still alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to approach a menstruating woman to have sexual relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your neighbor’s wife and thereby become ceremonially unclean with her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are not to present any of your children to Molech as a sacrifice. That way, you won’t defile the name of your God.”
“I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to have sexual relations with a male as you would with a woman. It’s detestable.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to present yourself to an animal in order to have sexual relations with it and by doing so to defile yourself. A woman is not to present herself to an animal to have sexual relations with it. It’s detestable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to defile yourselves by doing any of these things, since all of these nations that I’m casting out before you have defiled themselves this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land has been defiled, so I brought the punishment of its iniquity to it. As a result, the land is vomiting out its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, keep my statutes and ordinances. You are not to do any of these detestable things—this applies to the native born and the resident alien who lives among you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the inhabitants of the land did all of these detestable things and by doing so defiled the land before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are not to let the land vomit you up because of your uncleanness as it is vomiting the nations that were here before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does any of these detestable things—whoever the person may be—is to be eliminated from contact with his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, keep my injunctions so that you won’t practice these detestable things that have been done before you, and so that you won’t be defiled in them. I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the entire assembly of Israel that they are to be holy, since I, the Lord your God, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Each of you is to fear his mother and father.
“Observe my Sabbaths. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to turn to their idols or cast gods out of melted metal for yourselves. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you offer a peace offering to the Lord, you are to offer it for your acceptance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your sacrifice is to be eaten on that day and the next day. Anything that remains to the third day is to be incinerated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is eaten on the third day, it’s unclean. It won’t be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who eats it will bear the punishment of his sin, since he will have defiled himself regarding the Lord’s holy things. That person is to be eliminated from contact with his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you reap the harvest of your land, you are not to completely finish harvesting the corners of the field—that is, you are not to pick what remains after you have reaped your harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to gather your vineyard or pick up the fallen grapes of your vineyard. Leave something for the poor and the resident alien who lives among you. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to steal or lie or deal falsely with your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to use my name to deceive, thereby defiling the name of your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are not to oppress your neighbor or rob him.
“The wages of a hired laborer are not to remain in your possession until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are not to curse a deaf person or put a stumbling block before the blind.
“You are to fear God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to be unjust in deciding a case. You are not to show partiality to the poor or honor the great. Instead, decide the case of your neighbor with righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are not to go around slandering your people.
“You are not to stand idle when your neighbor’s life is at stake. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to hate your relative in your heart. Rebuke your neighbor if you must, but you are not to incur guilt on account of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to seek vengeance or hold a grudge against the descendants of your people. Instead, love your neighbor as yourself. I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Observe my statutes.
“You are not to let your cattle breed with a different species.
“You are not to sow your fields with two different kinds of seeds.
“You are not to wear clothing made from two different kinds of material.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a person has sexual relations with a woman servant who is engaged to another man, but she has not been completely redeemed nor has her freedom been granted to her, there is to be an inquiry, but they won’t be put to death, since she has not been freed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The perpetrator is to bring his guilt offering to the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting—that is, a ram as a guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to make atonement for him with the ram as a guilt offering in the Lord’s presence on account of his sin which he has committed, but which will be forgiven him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have entered the land and planted all sorts of trees for food, regard its fruit as uncircumcised for the first three years for you. It is not to be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the fourth year, all its fruit is to be offered as a holy token of praise to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the fifth year, you may eat its fruits to increase its produce for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to eat anything containing blood, engage in occult practices, or practice fortune telling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to cut your hair in ritualistic patterns on your head or deface the edges of your beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to make incisions in your flesh on account of the dead nor submit to cuts or tattoos. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to defile your daughter by engaging her in prostitution so the land won’t become filled with wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Observe my Sabbath and stand in awe of my sanctuary. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to consult neither mediums nor familiar spirits. You are never to seek them—you’ll just be defiled by them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Rise in the presence of the aged and honor the elderly face-to-face.
“Fear your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a resident alien lives with you in your land, you are not to mistreat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to treat the resident alien the same way you treat the native born among you—love him like yourself, since you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to act unjustly in deciding a case or when measuring weight and quantity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to maintain just balances and reliable standards for weights, dry volumes, and liquid volumes. I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe all my statutes and all my ordinances in order to practice them. I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that when an Israeli or a resident alien who lives in Israel offers his child to Molech, he is certainly to be put to death. The people who live in the land are to stone him with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, I’ll oppose that man. I’ll eliminate him from contact with his people for sacrificing his children to Molech, thereby defiling my sanctuary and profaning my holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the people avoid dealing with that man when he offers his child to Molech—that is, if they fail to execute him—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I’ll oppose that man and his family and eliminate him from contact with his people, along with all the prostitutes who accompany him and who have committed prostitution with Molech.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll oppose and eliminate from contact with his people whoever consults mediums or familiar spirits, thereby committing spiritual prostitution with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, separate yourselves and be holy, because I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep my statutes and observe them. I am the Lord, who has set you apart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Anyone who curses his father or mother is certainly to be put to death. He has cursed his father or mother, so his guilt will remain his responsibility.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone commits adultery with another man’s wife, including when someone commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife, both the adulterer and the adulteress are to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has sexual relations with his father’s wife, he has exposed his father’s nakedness, so both of them are to be put to death. Their guilt will remain their responsibility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has sexual relations with his daughter-in-law, the two are to be put to death. They’ve committed a repulsive act. Their guilt will remain their responsibility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has sexual relations with another male as he would with a woman, both have committed a repulsive act. They are certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man takes a wife along with her mother, that’s wickedness. They are to be burned with fire—that is, both him and them, so that there will be no wickedness in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has sexual relations with an animal, he is to be put to death, and you are also to kill the animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a woman approaches any animal to have sexual relations with it, both the woman and the animal are to be put to death. Their guilt will remain their responsibility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man takes his sister, his father’s daughter, or his mother’s daughter, so that he exposes her nakedness and she exposes his nakedness, it’s a shameful thing. They are to be eliminated from contact with their people in front of their people’s children. He has exposed his sister’s nakedness. He’ll continue to bear responsibility for his iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has sexual relations with a menstruating woman, he has exposed her nakedness, laying bare her fountain. He has exposed the source of her blood. Both are to be eliminated from contact with their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to have sexual relations with your mother’s sister or your father’s sister, because that is laying bare the nakedness of his close relative. They’ll continue to bear responsibility for their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has sexual relations with his uncle’s wife, he has exposed his uncle’s nakedness. They are to bear responsibility for punishment of their sin. They’ll die childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man takes his brother’s wife, it’s immoral. He has exposed his brother’s nakedness. They’ll be childless.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be sure to keep all my statutes and observe all my ordinances, so that the land where I’m about to bring you to live won’t vomit you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to live by the customs of the nations, whom I’ve cast away right in front of you. Because they did all of these things, I detested them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I’ve promised you that you’ll inherit the land that I’m about to give you as your permanent possession—a land flowing with milk and honey.
“I am your God. I’ve separated you from the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to differentiate between the clean animal and the unclean and between the unclean bird and the clean. You are not to make yourselves detestable on account of any animal, bird, or any creeping creature of the ground that I’ve separated for you as unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to be holy toward me, because I, the Lord, am holy. I’ve separated you from among the people to be mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, a man or a woman who has a ritual spirit or a familiar spirit is certainly to die. They are to be stoned to death with boulders. They will continue to bear responsibility for their guilt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Speak to the priests, Aaron’s sons, and tell them that no priest is to defile himself on account of the dead among his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except his close relatives—his mother, father, son, daughter, brother, or
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: virgin sister (who is a near relative of him and did not have a husband— he may defile himself for her).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he is a husband among his people, he is not to defile himself, thereby polluting himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are not to cut their hair in ritualistic patterns on their heads, deface the edges of their beards, or make incisions in their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to be holy to their God. They are not to defile the name of their God, because they’re the ones who bring the offerings of the Lord made by fire—the food of their God—so they are to be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are not to marry a prostitute or a woman who has been dishonored or who was divorced from her husband, because the priest is holy to his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consecrate him, because he’s the one who offers the food of your God. He is to be holy for you, because I, the Lord, the one who sanctifies you, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now if the daughter of any priest defiles herself by being a prostitute, she defiles her father. She is to be incinerated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The high priest among his relatives—whose head has been anointed with oil and who has been consecrated to put on the priestly clothing—is not to let his hair hang loose or to tear his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to come near any dead body—whether the deceased is his father or his mother—so as not to defile himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to go out of the sanctuary or defile the sanctuary of his God, because his God’s consecrating oil of anointing rests on him. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Furthermore, he is to marry a true virgin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to marry a widow or one who has been divorced, has been defiled, or has been a prostitute. Instead, he is to take a virgin from among his people as his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is not to defile his children among his people, because I am the Lord, who sets him apart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron that whoever of your descendants throughout their generations has a bodily defect is not to approach to offer the food of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, any person who has a defect is not to approach the Tent of Meeting— the blind, the lame, one who is mutilated in the face or who has a very long limb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a person who has a fractured foot or hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: has scoliosis, is a dwarf, or has an eye defect, an itching disease, scabs, or a crushed testicle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the descendants of Aaron the priest who has a defect is to approach to bring offerings of the Lord made by fire, since he has a defect. He is not to approach to offer the food of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, he may eat the food of his God, including the most holy and the holy offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he is not to enter through the curtain nor approach the altar, since he has a defect. That way, he won’t defile my sanctuary, since I am the Lord, who sets you apart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told all of this to Aaron, to his sons, and to all the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later on, the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron and his sons that they are to separate themselves for the sacred things of the Israelis and that they are not to defile my holy name. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them that whoever among your descendants throughout your generations approaches the sacred things that the Israelis had consecrated to the Lord while still remaining unclean is to be eliminated from my presence. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one of Aaron’s descendants has an infectious skin disease or a discharge, he is not to eat anything sacred until he has been cleansed. Anyone who touches an unclean thing on account of the dead, or who has a seminal discharge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or who becomes unclean by touching a creeping creature or another human being, whatever the uncleanness may be—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: such a person who comes in contact with anything like this will become unclean until evening. As a result, he is not to eat the sacred things unless he has bathed himself with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun has gone down and he has been cleansed, he may eat of the sacred things, since that’s his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to eat the carcass of an animal that was torn by animals, thereby defiling himself with it. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to keep my charge. By doing so, they won’t bear the punishment of sin because of it and therefore die if they’ve been defiled by it. I am the Lord, who sets them apart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No resident alien is to eat anything sacred. Neither the visitor of the priest nor a hired laborer is to eat anything sacred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a priest acquires a slave as property with his own money, he may eat with him. Those who were born in his house may eat his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a priest’s daughter marries a resident alien, she is not to eat the sacred raised offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the priest’s daughter is a widow, or is divorced and childless, so that she has to return to her father’s house as in her younger days, she may eat her father’s food, but no resident alien may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person eats anything sacred inadvertently, he is to add a fifth part to it and then give the sacred thing to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not to defile the sacred things of the Israelis that they have offered to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thereby causing them to bear the punishment of their iniquity for wrongdoing when they eat their sacred things, because I am the Lord, who sets them apart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelis that when a person from the house of Israel or from the resident aliens living in Israel brings his offering to the Lord as a whole burnt offering (whether in fulfillment of a promise or a free will offerings),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he’ll be sure to be accepted, he is to offer a male without defect from the bulls, the lambs, and the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, whatever has a defect is not to be offered, because it won’t be acceptable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a person brings a peace offering sacrifice to the Lord to fulfill a vow or a free will offering from the herd or the flock, it is to be sound in order to be accepted, without any defect in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to bring to the Lord an offering that is blind, fractured, mutilated, or infected with ulcers, scurvy, or scales. You are not to present any of them as an offering made by fire on the altar for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You may offer a bull or lamb that has one limb longer than the other or that is stunted as a free will offering, but it’s not acceptable in fulfillment of a promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to bring to the Lord an animal that has been emasculated, crushed, torn, or cut apart. You are not to practice this in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A resident alien is not to offer as food to your God any of these items, because they are afflicted with ritual corruption due to their defects. They’re not acceptable for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever a bull, a sheep, or a goat is born, it is to remain for seven days under the care of its mother. But on the eighth day onwards, it may be accepted as an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you are not to slaughter a bull or a ewe along with its offspring on the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the Lord, bring it so that it’s acceptable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be eaten that same day. You are not to leave any of it until morning. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Keep my commands and observe them. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to defile my sacred name, because I’ve been set apart in the midst of the Israelis. Furthermore, I am the Lord, who sets you apart—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that these are my festival times appointed by the Lord that you are to declare as sacred assemblies:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you may work, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of rest, a sacred assembly. You are not to do any work. It’s a Sabbath to the Lord wherever you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the Lord’s appointed festivals and sacred assemblies that you are to declare at their appointed time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord’s Passover is to begin on the fourteenth day of the first month at twilight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of that month is the Festival of Unleavened Bread to the Lord. For seven days you are to eat unleavened bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day that you hold the sacred assembly, you are to do no servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you are to bring an offering made by fire to the Lord daily for seven days. On the seventh day, you are also to hold a sacred assembly during which you are to do no servile work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that when you enter the land that I’m about to give you and gather its produce, you are to bring a sheaf from the first portion of your harvest to the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will offer the sheaf in the Lord’s presence for your acceptance. The priest is to wave it on the day after the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day you wave the sheaf, you are to offer a one year old male lamb without defect for a burnt offering in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also present a meal offering of two tenths of a measure of fine flour mixed with olive oil as an offering made by fire to the Lord, a pleasing aroma. Now as to a drink offering, you are to present a fourth of a hin of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to eat bread, parched grain, or fresh grain until that day when you’ve brought the offering of your God. This is to be an eternal ordinance throughout your generations, wherever you live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Starting the day after the Sabbath, count for yourselves seven weeks from the day you brought the sheaf of the wave offering. They are to be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Count fifty days to the day after the seventh Sabbath, then bring a new meal offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring two loaves of bread from home as wave offerings made from two tenths of fine flour baked with leaven as first fruits to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along with the loaves of bread, bring seven lambs (each of them one year old and without defect), one young bull as an offering, and two rams as offerings to the Lord—along with your gift and drink offerings—and present them as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepare one male goat for a sin offering and two one year old rams for peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to wave them—the two lambs with the bread of first fruits—as raised offerings in the Lord’s presence. They’ll be sacred to the Lord on account of the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the same day, proclaim a sacred assembly for yourselves. You are not to do any servile work—and this is to be an eternal ordinance wherever you live throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, when you harvest the produce of your land, you are not to harvest all the way to the corners of your field or gather the gleanings of your harvest. Leave them for the poor and resident alien. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that on the first day of the seventh month you are to have a Sabbath of rest for you—a memorial announced by a loud blast of trumpets. It is to be a sacred assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to do any servile work. Instead, bring an offering made by fire to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, on the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. It’s a sacred assembly for you. Humble yourselves and bring an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to do any work that same day. It’s the Day of Atonement, because your atonement is made in the presence of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who doesn’t humble himself that same day is to be eliminated from contact with his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll eliminate anyone who does work that day from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to do any work. This is to be an eternal ordinance throughout your generations, wherever you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s a Sabbath of rest for you on which you are to humble yourselves starting the evening of the ninth day of the month. You are to observe your Sabbath from evening to evening.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that starting the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the week-long Festival of Tents to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day, you are to hold a sacred assembly, when you are not to do any servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days, bring offerings made by fire to the Lord. The eighth day is also to be a sacred assembly for you. Bring offerings made by fire to the Lord. It’s a sacred assembly. You are not to do any servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the Lord’s appointed festivals that you are to proclaim as sacred assemblies. Bring offerings made by fire to the Lord—a whole burnt offering, a meal offering, a sacrifice, and drink offerings. Do this every day on its assigned date
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in addition to the Lord’s Sabbath—regarding your gifts, your offerings in fulfillment of vows, and your freely given offerings that you will bring to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you’ve harvested the produce of the land, you are to observe the festival of the Lord for seven days. The first day is to be a Sabbath rest, and the eighth day also is to be a Sabbath rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day, take branches from impressive fruit trees, branches from palm trees, boughs from thick trees, and poplars from the brooks. Then you are to rejoice in the presence of the Lord your God for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe it as a pilgrimage festival in the presence of the Lord for seven days of the year. This is to be an eternal ordinance throughout your generations. Observe the festival during the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to live in tents for seven days. Every native born of Israel is to live in tents
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order for your future generations to know that the Israelis lived in tents when I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Moses spoke about to the Israelis regarding the Lord’s appointed festivals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that they are to bring to you pure oil made from beaten olives in order to keep the lamp burning continuously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outside the Canopy of the Testimony in the Tent of Meeting, Aaron is to arrange it continually in the Lord’s presence from evening until morning as an eternal ordinance throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to arrange the lamps so that they burn continuously on a ceremonially pure lamp stand in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take fine flour and bake twelve cakes using two tenths of a measure for each cake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arrange them in two rows—six in each row—on a ceremonially pure table in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put pure frankincense on each row for a memorial offering. It will serve as an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to be arranged every Sabbath day in the Lord’s presence as a gift from the Israelis—an eternal covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This gift will belong to Aaron and his sons, and they are to eat it in a sacred place, because it’s the most holy thing for him of all the offerings made by fire to the Lord. This is to be an eternal ordinance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a son of an Israeli woman and an Egyptian man went out among the Israelis. The Israeli woman’s son got into a fight with an Israeli man in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israeli woman’s son blasphemed the Name and cursed, so they brought him to Moses. His mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, from the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They placed him in custody until a decision would be made to them according to the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the one who cursed outside the camp. Everyone who heard him is to lay their hands on his head. Then the entire congregation is to stone him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, tell the Israelis that anyone who curses his God will bear the consequences of his own sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the one who blasphemes the name of the Lord is certainly to be put to death. The entire congregation is to stone him to death. As it is for the resident alien, so it is to be with the native born: when he blasphemes the Name, he is to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man beats a human being to death, he is certainly to be executed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever beats an animal to death is to replace it—life for life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man disfigures his fellow, whatever he did is to be done to him also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth—just as he had caused a disfigurement against another man, so it is to be done against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever beats an animal to death is to replace it, but whoever beats a human being to death is to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to have for yourselves consistent procedures in deciding a case. As it is for the resident alien, so it is for the native born. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the Israelis and they brought the one who cursed outside the camp and stoned him to death with boulders. The Israelis did just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses on Mount Sinai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that when you enter the land that I’m about to give you, you are to let the land observe a Sabbath to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six years you may plant your fields, and for six years you may prune your vineyard and gather its produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the seventh year is to be a Sabbath of rest for the land—a Sabbath for the Lord. You are not to plant your field or prune your vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to gather what grows from the spilled kernels of your crops. You are not to pick the grapes of your untrimmed vines. Let it be a year of Sabbath for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may take the Sabbath produce of the land for your food—you, your male and maid servants, your hired laborers, and the resident alien with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cattle and the wild animals in your land—everything it produces—are for your food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Count for yourselves seven years of Sabbaths—seven times seven years. This set of seven weeks of years total 49 years for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sound a horn on the tenth day of the seventh month of this fiftieth year. Likewise, on the Day of Atonement, sound the horn throughout your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set aside and consecrate the fiftieth year to declare liberty throughout the land for all of its inhabitants. It is to be a jubilee for you. Every person is to return to his own land that he has inherited. Likewise, every person is to return to his tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fiftieth year is to be a year of jubilee for you. You are not to sow or harvest the spilled kernels that grow of themselves or pick grapes from the untrimmed vines
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it’s the jubilee—it’s sacred for you. But you may eat its produce from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “During this year of jubilee, each person is to return to his own land that he has inherited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you had sold property to a neighbor or had acquired land from your neighbor, you are not to cheat one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number of years after the jubilee, you may buy from your neighbor. And according to the number of years with crops, he may sell to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the number of years after the jubilee is more, increase the selling price. If the number of years after the jubilee is few, decrease its selling price, because he’s selling to you according to the potential production volume of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is to cheat his neighbor. Instead, you are to fear your God, because I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Observe my statutes and keep my ordinances. Do them so that you may live securely in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the land will yield its fruit and you’ll eat to your satisfaction and live securely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now if you ask, ‘What will we eat during the seventh year? After all, we may not plant or even gather our produce!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll command my blessing on you during the sixth year so that it will yield produce for three years!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That way, you are to sow in the eighth year, eating the produce from the old harvest. Until the ninth year when its produce comes in, you’ll eat from the old harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The land is not to be sold with any finality, because the land belongs to me. You’re sojourners and travelers with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So throughout all of your land inheritance, grant the right of redemption for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your brother becomes so poor that he has to a sell portion of his inheritance, then his nearest kinsman redeemer is to come and redeem what his brother has sold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person doesn’t have a kinsman redeemer, but has become rich and found sufficient means for his redemption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let him account for the years for which it was sold, return the excess to the person to whom it was sold, and then return to his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he’s not able to redeem it back for himself, then what he sold is to remain in the hand of the buyer until the year of jubilee. In the jubilee, it is to be returned so he may return to his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a person sells a residential house in a walled city, he is to redeem it within the year in which it was sold. He may have right to its redemption for a full year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it’s not redeemed by the end of a full year, then the house next to which is a wall is to belong in perpetuity to the one who bought it throughout his generations. It is not to be returned in the jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the houses in the villages that don’t have walls around them are to be categorized along with the fields of the land—they may be redeemed and returned in the jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the cities that belong to the descendants of Levi—that is, the houses in the cities that belong to them—are to belong to the descendants of Levi perpetually as part of their right of redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone from the descendants of Levi redeems the houses in the cities that they own, they are to be returned in the jubilee, because the houses of the cities of the descendants of Levi are to remain their property among the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, the open land of their cities is not to be sold, because it is to remain their perpetual inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your relative becomes so poor that he is indebted to you, then you are to support him. You are to let him live with you just like the resident alien and the traveler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to take interest or profit from him. Instead, you are to fear your God and let your relative live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to loan him money with interest or sell him your food at a profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your brother with you becomes so poor that he sells himself to you, you are not to make him serve like a bond slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, he is to serve with you like a hired servant or a traveler who lives with you, until the year of jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he and his children with him may leave to return to his family and his ancestor’s inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they’re my servants whom I’ve brought out of the land of Egypt, they are not to be sold as slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to rule over them with harshness. You are to fear your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for your male and maid slaves who will be with you, you may buy male and female slaves from among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may also buy from resident aliens who live among you and their families who are with you, whom they fathered in your land. They may become your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may give them as inherited property to your children after you, to own as properties in perpetuity. You may make bond slaves of them, but no one is to rule over his fellow Israeli with harshness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a resident alien or traveler becomes rich, but your relative who lives next to him is so poor that he sells himself to that resident alien or traveler among you or to a member of the resident alien’s family,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he has the right to be redeemed after he sells himself. One of his brothers may redeem him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him or any blood relative from his tribe may redeem him. If he becomes rich, then he may redeem himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He is to bring an accounting to the one who bought him, starting from the year he had sold himself until the year of jubilee. The price of his sale is to correspond to the number of years comparable to the time a hired servant stays with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there are still many years left, he is to refund the cost of his redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if only a few years are left until the year of jubilee, he is to bring an accounting of the years that he is to refund for his redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a hired servant, he is to remain with him year after year, but he is not to rule over him with what you see as severity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he isn’t redeemed by these, then he is to be set free in the year of jubilee—he and his children with him—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Israelis are my servants. They’re my servants, since I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to make worthless idols, images, or pillars for yourselves, nor set up for yourselves carved images to bow down to them in the land, because I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to keep my Sabbath and fear my sanctuary. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you live by my statutes, obey my commands, and observe them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I’ll send your rain in its season so that the land will yield its produce and the trees of the field will yield their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Threshing will extend to the time of vintage and the vintage will extend to the time of sowing, so that you’ll eat your bread to your satisfaction and live securely in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll give peace in the land so that you’ll lie down without fear. I’ll remove wild beasts from the land, and not even war will come to your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you’ll pursue your enemies and they’ll die by the sword before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of you will chase a hundred, a hundred of you will chase ten thousand, and your enemies will fall by the sword before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll look after you, ensuring that you’ll be fruitful. I’ll increase your number and keep my covenant with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have consumed what was stored of the old, then you’ll take out the old and replace it with what’s new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll set up my tent in your midst and I won’t loathe you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll walk among you. I will be your God, and you’ll be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt so that you will no longer be their slaves, since I’ve broken their oppressive yoke upon you to make you walk upright.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you won’t listen to me and obey all these commands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you refuse my statutes, loathe my ordinances, and fail to carry out all of my commands, thereby breaching my covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will certainly do this to you: I’ll appoint sudden terror to infect you like tuberculosis and fever. Your eyes will fail and your life will waste away. You’ll plant in vain, because your enemies will consume what you plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll set my face against you so that you’ll be defeated before your enemies. Those who hate you will have dominion over you and you’ll keep fleeing even when no one is pursuing you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If, despite all of this, you still don’t listen to me, then I’ll punish you seven times more on account of your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll break your mighty pride. I’ll make the heavens to be like iron and the ground like bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your strength will be spent in vain, because your land won’t yield its produce and the trees of the land won’t yield their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you live life contrary to me and remain unwilling to listen to me, then I’ll add to your wounds seven times more on account of your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll send wild beasts against you from the open country to deprive you of your children, destroy your cattle, and decrease your number so that your roads become desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If, despite these things, you still won’t return to me, but live life contrary to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I’ll certainly oppose you. I’ll take vengeance against you seven fold on account of your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll bring the sword against you to execute the vengeance of my covenant. When you gather in your cities, I’ll send a pestilence. As a result, you’ll be delivered into the control of your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I destroy the source of your bread, ten women will bake bread in one oven. Then they’ll return back your bread by weight. You’ll eat but won’t be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If, after all of this time, you don’t listen to me, but instead live life contrary to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll oppose you with vicious rage. Indeed, I myself will punish you seven fold on account of your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, you’ll eat the flesh of your sons and you’ll eat the flesh of your daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll destroy your high places and cut down your sun pillars. Then I’ll cast your dead bodies on top of the bodies of your idols. I’ll loathe you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll lay your cities to waste and destroy your sanctuaries so I don’t have to smell the scent of your soothing odors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll make the land so desolate that your enemies who live in it will be astonished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll scatter you among the nations and draw the sword after you so that your land becomes desolate and your towns become ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the land will finally be pleased with its Sabbaths as long as it lies desolate while you are in the land of your enemies. At that time, the land will rest and take its Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as it lies desolate, it will have rest that it will not have had during your Sabbaths when you were living in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the remnants among you, I’ll bring despair in their hearts in the land of their enemies so that even the sound of a blown leaf will chase them and they flee as though pursued by the sword and fall when no one is pursuing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They’ll stumble over each other as though fleeing before the sword, even though no one is pursuing.
“You won’t have power to resist your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ll perish among the nations and the land of your enemies will consume you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remnants among you will waste away in the land of your enemies due to their iniquity. Indeed, they’ll also waste away on account of the iniquities of their ancestors with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Nevertheless, when they confess their iniquity, the iniquity of their ancestors, and their unfaithfulness by which they acted unfaithfully against me by living life contrary to me—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: causing me to oppose them and take them to the land of their enemies so that the uncircumcised foreskin of their hearts can be humbled and so that they accept the punishment of their iniquity—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I’ll remember my covenant with Jacob, my covenant with Isaac, and my covenant with Abraham. I’ll also remember the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will leave the land so it can rest while it lies desolate without them. That’s when they’ll receive the punishment of their iniquity, because indeed they will have rejected my ordinances and despised my statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet, despite all of these things, when they’re in the land of their enemies, I won’t reject or despise them so as to completely destroy them and by doing so violate my covenant with them, because I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, on account of them, I’ll remember my covenant with their ancestors when I brought them out of the land of Egypt right before the eyes of the nations, so that I could be their God. I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes, ordinances, and laws that the Lord made between himself and the Israelis on Mount Sinai, as recorded by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that when a person makes a special vow based on the appropriate value of people who belong to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if your valuation of the vow is for a male from 20 to 60 years old, the valuation is to be 50 shekels of silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she is a female from 20 to 60 years old, then your valuation is to be 30 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person is from five to 20 years, then your valuation for a male is to be 20 shekels and for a female ten shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person is from one month to five years old, then your valuation for a male is to be five shekels of silver, and for a female your valuation is to be three shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person is 60 or more years old, then your valuation for a male is to be fifteen shekels and for a female ten shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he is too poor to be valuated, then cause him to stand before the priest and let the priest set a value on him according to the ability of the one making the vow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If it’s an animal from which they make an offering to the Lord, everything that he gives to the Lord from it will be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to substitute it or exchange it—the good with the bad or the bad with the good. If he ever makes an exchange of an animal for an animal, then it and what’s being exchanged is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any animal is unclean, which cannot be brought to the Lord as an offering, make the animal stand in the presence of the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the priest will evaluate it as to whether it is good or bad. According to your—that is, the priest’s—valuation, so it is to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kinsman redeemer decides to redeem it, then he is to add a fifth to your valuation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a person consecrates his house to be holy to the Lord, then the priest is to set a value for it as to its worth, whether good or bad. As the priest sets value on it, so it will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he that consecrated it wishes to redeem his house, he is to add one fifth to your valuation, after which it is to belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a person consecrates to the Lord a portion of the field from his inheritance, then your valuation is to be based on its capacity for yielding a harvest. Each omer of barley is to be valued at 50 shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he consecrates his field in the year of jubilee, it is to be based on your valuation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he consecrates his field after the jubilee, then the priest is to account to him the silver according to the years that remain until the year of jubilee, with a deduction corresponding to your valuation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the one who consecrated the field intends to redeem it, then he is to add one fifth of your valuation to it in silver, then it is to be established as his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he won’t redeem the field, but instead sells it to another person, then it is not to be redeemed anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the field is released in the jubilee, it will be holy to the Lord. As a field that’s devoted, it is to belong to the priest as his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he consecrates a field that he had bought and that isn’t part of his inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the priest is to account to him the evaluated worth until the year of jubilee. Then he is to give the amount of valuation on that day as a holy gift to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the year of jubilee, the field is to be returned by the one who originally sold it—that is, to the owner of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every valuation is to be according to the shekel of the sanctuary, evaluated at 20 gerahs to the shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No person is to consecrate the firstborn, because the firstborn of the animals already belongs to the Lord. Whether ox or goat, it belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it’s an unclean animal, then he is to ransom it according to your valuation, adding a fifth to it. If it’s not redeemed, then it is to be sold according to your valuation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, any devoted thing that a person consecrates to the Lord from what he owns—whether man, animals, or inherited fields—is not to be sold or redeemed. Any devoted thing is most sacred. It belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But anyone who is completely devoted from among human beings is not to be ransomed. He is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Any tithes of the land—from grain grown on the land or from fruit grown on the trees—belong to the Lord. They are sacred to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a person wishes to redeem his tithe, he is to add a fifth to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the tithes from cattle and flocks that pass under the measuring rod are sacred to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to examine it to see if it’s good or bad or even exchange it. If he does exchange it, what has been exchanged as well as its substitute is sacred. It is not to be redeemed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commands that the Lord commanded Moses to deliver to the Israelis on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator
